content.title: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
content.details: The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) aims to enhance livelihood security in rural areas by providing at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to every rural household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.
benefits: Empowerment of women and marginalized groups
eligibility: Willing to do unskilled manual work
content.application_process: Registration can be done at the local Gram Panchayat office throughout the year.

faqs.question: Who Are The Key Stakeholders In MGNREGA?
faqs.answer: The key stakeholders in MGNREGA are wage seekers, Gram Sabha, Three-tier Panchayati Raj Institutions, Programme Officer at the Block level, District Programme Coordinator, State Government, Ministry of Rural Development, Civil Society, and other stakeholders.

faqs.question: Will The Wage Be Paid Monthly, Weekly Or On Daily Basis?
faqs.answer: The disbursement of daily wages shall be made on a weekly basis or not later than a fortnight after the work was done.

faqs.question: What Is Wage Rate For Women Employed For Providing Child Care Services?
faqs.answer: The women so employed should be paid remuneration equivalent to the prevailing wage rate.

faqs.question: What Information Will Be Provided In The Wage Slip?
faqs.answer: Individual pay slips should have details like work ID, wage rate, number of days worked, amount earned, number of mandays completed, and number of mandays of employment due.

faqs.question: How Are The Payments Of Wages Made To The Wage Seekers?
faqs.answer: Payments shall be made through the individual savings accounts of the workers in relevant banks or post offices.

faqs.question: Is There Any Authentic Document Required To Open The Wage Seeker Account?
faqs.answer: MGNREGS Job Card, duly signed by the concerned officer, is an officially valid document for opening a bank account.

faqs.question: Is there any compensation for delay in payment of wages?
faqs.answer: Workers are entitled to receive delay compensation at a rate of 0.05 per cent of the unpaid wages per day for delays beyond the sixteenth day.

faqs.question: What social security is provided for MGNREGS workers?
faqs.answer: Insurance provided includes Janashree Bima Yojana for life coverage and Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana for health coverage.

faqs.question: Who Is Designated As PO In MGNREGS?
faqs.answer: Executive authorities such as Tehsildar/Block Development Officer are designated as Programme Officers.

faqs.question: Is There Any Pre-Printed Form For Providing Details While Registering For Job Card?
faqs.answer: The State Government may provide a printed form, but it should not be insisted upon.

faqs.question: Can All Adult Members Of A Household Register For Job Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, all adult members willing to do unskilled manual work can register.

faqs.question: For How Many Years Is The Registration For Job Card Valid?
faqs.answer: The registration is valid for five years and may be renewed as required.

faqs.question: When Is An Applicant Eligible For Unemployment Allowance?
faqs.answer: If employment is not provided within fifteen days of application, unemployment allowance becomes due.

faqs.question: Who Constitutes Special Category Of Workers Under MGNREGA?
faqs.answer: Special categories include persons with disabilities, tribal groups, women in special circumstances, and senior citizens.

faqs.question: Are Any Special Works Identified For Differently Abled Persons Working Under MGNREGA?
faqs.answer: Yes, works like drinking water arrangements and plantation are identified for differently abled persons.

faqs.question: Who Are Eligible To Become Members In Labour Groups?
faqs.answer: Workers who have put in 10 days of work during the previous year are eligible.

faqs.question: What Is The Procedure To Register Oneself For Employment?
faqs.answer: Households may apply for registration at the local Gram Panchayat office.

faqs.question: If The Information Contained In The Application Found To Be Incorrect, What Is The Process?
faqs.answer: The application will be referred to the PO for verification and processing.

faqs.question: Should The Cost Towards Job Card Be Borne By The Applicant?
faqs.answer: No, the cost of Job Cards is covered under administrative expenses.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision To Provide Duplicate Job Card For A Lost One?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Job Cardholder may apply for a duplicate if the original is lost or damaged.
